event: Nvidia was founded.
The three co-founders believed in the direction of accelerated computing.
Nvidia went public.
Nvidia released the GeForce 256 (NV10) with on-board transformation and lighting.
The GeForce2 GTS was shipped.
Nvidia reached an agreement to acquire the intellectual assets of 3dfx.
Nvidia acquired Exluna.
Nvidia acquired MediaQ.
Nvidia acquired iReady.
Nvidia acquired ULI Electronics.
Nvidia acquired Hybrid Graphics.
Nvidia received subpoenas from the U.S. Department of Justice.
Nvidia was named Forbes Company of the Year.
Nvidia acquired Ageia.
Nvidia faced a class-action lawsuit over manufacturing defects.
Nvidia signed a cross-licensing agreement with Intel.
Nvidia released its Tegra 3 ARM system-on-a-chip.
Nvidia agreed to acquire Icera.
Nvidia unveiled the Tegra 4 and the Nvidia Shield.
Nvidia acquired PGI.
Nvidia unveiled the first GPUs of the GeForce 10 series.
Nvidia settled a false advertising lawsuit regarding the GTX 970 model.
Nvidia announced a partnership with Toyota for autonomous vehicles.
Nvidia announced an AI partnership with Baidu.
Nvidia released the Titan V.
Nvidia released the Nvidia Quadro GV100.
Nvidia released the RTX 2080 GPUs.
Nvidia developed an open-source ventilator for the global pandemic.
Nvidia announced the Ampere GPU microarchitecture and the Nvidia A100 GPU accelerator.
Nvidia announced the GeForce 30 series.
Nvidia announced the acquisition of Arm from SoftBank Group.
Nvidia announced plans to build a powerful computer in Cambridge, England.
Nvidia retired the Quadro brand and shifted to Nvidia RTX.
Nvidia announced the acquisition of Mellanox Technologies.
Nvidia announced new RTX Studio laptops.
Nvidia announced Minecraft RTX.
Nvidia announced its next-generation automotive-grade chip, Drive Thor.
Nvidia unveiled the A800 GPU in China to meet export control rules.
